results.title: Beaches and boats
results.creator_credit: Leith Goodall, Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film depicts the beauty of Western Australia’s beaches and the lifestyle that can be enjoyed there. Sandy beaches stretch along the West Australian coast for hundreds of miles, providing an ideal place for a holiday of boating, water-skiing, surfboard riding, and sunbathing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leith Goodall, Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit

results.title: Be a sport
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Great Britain Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A survey of sport and athletics in Great Britain, showing several champions and promising newcomers training as well as competing. Johnny Haynes demonstrates the art of ball control; Diane Leather, first women five-minute miler; Gordon Pirie competing in a two-mile event; Christine Truman, tennis star; Pat Smythe shows skill in show jumping; Jeanette Altwegge and Cecilia Colledge, figure skaters. Sporting activities play an important part in the everyday life of English people and a high degree of skill is maintained.

results.title: Careers for girls
results.creator_credit: Time-Life Productions, Forum Films and March of Time
results.brief_description: This segment, produced as part of ‘The March of Time’ newsreel and documentary series, provides general career advice for young women in post-WWII America. The suggested career paths are reflective of the late 1940s, focusing on areas such as office work, nursing, fashion and retail. But rather than restrict the options to these areas, career advancement and less traditional career paths, like science and medicine, are addressed. Pointers on how to find a job matched to your personality are interspersed with successful women in each particular field. ‘The March of Time’ series was produced between 1935 and 1951 and, whilst a very popular series, failed to make money due to high production costs.

results.title: Fashion means business
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
This film highlights the fashion industry in America. Top designers in New York and Paris are shown at work and a survey of America’s garment district gives some idea of the enormous size of the industry.

results.title: Life with junior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A typical day in the life of a ten-year-old, presenting such common problems as the acceptance of a new brother and the refusal to eat. Emphasises the anxieties of parents over guiding their children in today’s world, and explains ways in which to cope with behaviour problems.

results.title: The F.B.I.
results.creator_credit: Fortune Films, Time-Life Films and Time Inc
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Describes the 24-hour-a-day vigilance of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the techniques and crime detection methods shown at the F.B.I. laboratories, and the rigorous training an agent must undergo. Dramatizes the case of the Nazi spy, August Baumeyer, and illustrates the effectiveness of counter-espionage by the F.B.I. Features F.B.I. Director, John Edgar Hoover.

results.title: Upbeat in music
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Produced during World War II, this film illustrates the special organisation and arrangments made to provide adequate musical entertainment for troops, both at home and abroad. One particular section deals with the successful fight by the American Federation of Musicians led by James C. Petrillo, to have (in part) royalties paid to a union unemployment fund. Includes such performers as Marian Anderson, George Gershwin, Benny Goodman, Mischa Elman, Serge Koussevitsky, Glenn Miller, Art Tatum, Duke Ellington and Perry Como.

results.title: Search for happiness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Shows how the stresses and strains of modern living lead to many unhappy people seeking advice from radio counsellors, newspaper columnists, and fortune tellers.

results.title: Schools march on!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Emphasizes that the public eduction system has been a vital factor in the development of America even though there are many inadequacies in schools of rural communities. Shows how Woodford Country Illinois, successfully solved school problems through proper zooming and consolidation. From the “March of time forum film” series.
